    Saver Classes

    The flowerpower-io library provides several saver classes for writing data to various sources and formats. These classes extend the base classes and provide specialized functionality for specific data destinations.

    CSV Saver

    CSVSaver

    class CSVSaver(BaseFileWriter, gc=False)

    Saver for CSV files.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    path str \| list[str] Path or list of paths to CSV file(s).
    storage_options StorageOptions \| AwsStorageOptions \| GcsStorageOptions \| AzureStorageOptions \| GitLabStorageOptions \| GitHubStorageOptions \| dict[str, Any] \| None Storage-specific options for accessing remote filesystems.
    fs AbstractFileSystem \| None Filesystem instance for handling file operations.
    format str \| None File format extension (without dot). Default: "csv"
    basename str \| None Basename for the output file(s).
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: False
    mode str Write mode (append, overwrite, delete_matching, error_if_exists). Default: "append"
    unique bool \| list[str] \| str Unique columns for deduplication. Default: False
    csv_options dict[str, Any] Additional CSV writer options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    write (data: pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any] \| list[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any]]], basename: str \| None = None, concat: bool \| None = None, unique: bool \| list[str] \| str \| None = None, mode: str \| None = None, **kwargs) -> dict[str, Any] Write data to file.
    metadata property Get metadata for the written data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.saver import CSVSaver

# Initialize CSV saver
saver = CSVSaver(
    path="output/",
    basename="results",
    mode="append"
)

# Write data
metadata = saver.write(df)

    Parquet Saver

    ParquetSaver

    class ParquetSaver(BaseDatasetWriter, gc=False)

    Saver for Parquet files.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    path str \| list[str] Path or list of paths to Parquet file(s).
    storage_options StorageOptions \| AwsStorageOptions \| GcsStorageOptions \| AzureStorageOptions \| GitLabStorageOptions \| GitHubStorageOptions \| dict[str, Any] \| None Storage-specific options for accessing remote filesystems.
    fs AbstractFileSystem \| None Filesystem instance for handling file operations.
    format str \| None File format extension (without dot). Default: "parquet"
    basename str \| None Basename for the output file(s).
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: False
    mode str Write mode (append, overwrite, delete_matching, error_if_exists). Default: "append"
    unique bool \| list[str] \| str Unique columns for deduplication. Default: False
    schema_ pa.Schema \| None PyArrow schema for the dataset.
    partition_by str \| list[str] \| pds.Partitioning \| None Dataset partitioning scheme.
    partitioning_flavor str \| None Partitioning flavor for the dataset.
    compression str Compression codec for the dataset. Default: "zstd"
    row_group_size int \| None Row group size for the dataset. Default: 250000
    max_rows_per_file int \| None Maximum number of rows per file. Default: 2500000
    is_pydala_dataset bool Write data as a Pydala ParquetDataset. Default: False
    parquet_options dict[str, Any] Additional Parquet writer options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    write (data: pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any] \| list[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any]]], concat: bool \| None = None, unique: bool \| list[str] \| str \| None = None, mode: str \| None = None, delta_subset: str \| None = None, alter_schema: bool = False, update_metadata: bool = True, timestamp_column: str \| None = None, verbose: bool = False, **kwargs) -> dict[str, Any] Write data to dataset.
    metadata property Get metadata for the written data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.saver import ParquetSaver

# Initialize Parquet saver
saver = ParquetSaver(
    path="output/",
    basename="results",
    mode="append",
    partition_by="category",
    compression="zstd"
)

# Write data
metadata = saver.write(df)

    JSON Saver

    JSONSaver

    class JSONSaver(BaseFileWriter, gc=False)

    Saver for JSON files.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    path str \| list[str] Path or list of paths to JSON file(s).
    storage_options StorageOptions \| AwsStorageOptions \| GcsStorageOptions \| AzureStorageOptions \| GitLabStorageOptions \| GitHubStorageOptions \| dict[str, Any] \| None Storage-specific options for accessing remote filesystems.
    fs AbstractFileSystem \| None Filesystem instance for handling file operations.
    format str \| None File format extension (without dot). Default: "json"
    basename str \| None Basename for the output file(s).
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: False
    mode str Write mode (append, overwrite, delete_matching, error_if_exists). Default: "append"
    unique bool \| list[str] \| str Unique columns for deduplication. Default: False
    json_options dict[str, Any] Additional JSON writer options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    write (data: pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any] \| list[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any]]], basename: str \| None = None, concat: bool \| None = None, unique: bool \| list[str] \| str \| None = None, mode: str \| None = None, **kwargs) -> dict[str, Any] Write data to file.
    metadata property Get metadata for the written data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.saver import JSONSaver

# Initialize JSON saver
saver = JSONSaver(
    path="output/",
    basename="results",
    mode="append"
)

# Write data
metadata = saver.write(df)

    DeltaTable Saver

    DeltaTableSaver

    class DeltaTableSaver(BaseDatasetWriter, gc=False)

    Saver for Delta Lake tables.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    path str \| list[str] Path or list of paths to Delta Lake table(s).
    storage_options StorageOptions \| AwsStorageOptions \| GcsStorageOptions \| AzureStorageOptions \| GitLabStorageOptions \| GitHubStorageOptions \| dict[str, Any] \| None Storage-specific options for accessing remote filesystems.
    fs AbstractFileSystem \| None Filesystem instance for handling file operations.
    format str \| None File format extension (without dot). Default: "deltatable"
    basename str \| None Basename for the output file(s).
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: False
    mode str Write mode (append, overwrite, delete_matching, error_if_exists). Default: "append"
    unique bool \| list[str] \| str Unique columns for deduplication. Default: False
    schema_ pa.Schema \| None PyArrow schema for the dataset.
    partition_by str \| list[str] \| pds.Partitioning \| None Dataset partitioning scheme.
    partitioning_flavor str \| None Partitioning flavor for the dataset.
    compression str Compression codec for the dataset. Default: "zstd"
    row_group_size int \| None Row group size for the dataset. Default: 250000
    max_rows_per_file int \| None Maximum number of rows per file. Default: 2500000
    is_pydala_dataset bool Write data as a Pydala ParquetDataset. Default: False
    delta_options dict[str, Any] Additional Delta Lake writer options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    write (data: pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any] \| list[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any]]], concat: bool \| None = None, unique: bool \| list[str] \| str \| None = None, mode: str \| None = None, delta_subset: str \| None = None, alter_schema: bool = False, update_metadata: bool = True, timestamp_column: str \| None = None, verbose: bool = False, **kwargs) -> dict[str, Any] Write data to dataset.
    metadata property Get metadata for the written data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.saver import DeltaTableSaver

# Initialize DeltaTable saver
saver = DeltaTableSaver(
    path="delta_table/",
    basename="results",
    mode="append",
    partition_by="category",
    compression="zstd"
)

# Write data
metadata = saver.write(df)

    Pydala Saver

    PydalaSaver

    class PydalaSaver(BaseDatasetWriter, gc=False)

    Saver for Pydala datasets.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    path str \| list[str] Path or list of paths to Pydala dataset(s).
    storage_options StorageOptions \| AwsStorageOptions \| GcsStorageOptions \| AzureStorageOptions \| GitLabStorageOptions \| GitHubStorageOptions \| dict[str, Any] \| None Storage-specific options for accessing remote filesystems.
    fs AbstractFileSystem \| None Filesystem instance for handling file operations.
    format str \| None File format extension (without dot). Default: "pydala"
    basename str \| None Basename for the output file(s).
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: False
    mode str Write mode (append, overwrite, delete_matching, error_if_exists). Default: "append"
    unique bool \| list[str] \| str Unique columns for deduplication. Default: False
    schema_ pa.Schema \| None PyArrow schema for the dataset.
    partition_by str \| list[str] \| pds.Partitioning \| None Dataset partitioning scheme.
    partitioning_flavor str \| None Partitioning flavor for the dataset.
    compression str Compression codec for the dataset. Default: "zstd"
    row_group_size int \| None Row group size for the dataset. Default: 250000
    max_rows_per_file int \| None Maximum number of rows per file. Default: 2500000
    is_pydala_dataset bool Write data as a Pydala ParquetDataset. Default: False
    pydala_options dict[str, Any] Additional Pydala writer options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    write (data: pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any] \| list[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any]]], concat: bool \| None = None, unique: bool \| list[str] \| str \| None = None, mode: str \| None = None, delta_subset: str \| None = None, alter_schema: bool = False, update_metadata: bool = True, timestamp_column: str \| None = None, verbose: bool = False, **kwargs) -> dict[str, Any] Write data to dataset.
    metadata property Get metadata for the written data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.saver import PydalaSaver

# Initialize Pydala saver
saver = PydalaSaver(
    path="pydala_dataset/",
    basename="results",
    mode="append",
    partition_by="category",
    compression="zstd"
)

# Write data
metadata = saver.write(df)

    MQTT Saver

    MQTTSaver

    class MQTTSaver(BaseFileWriter, gc=False)

    Saver for MQTT messages.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    path str \| list[str] MQTT topic(s) to publish to.
    storage_options StorageOptions \| AwsStorageOptions \| GcsStorageOptions \| AzureStorageOptions \| GitLabStorageOptions \| GitHubStorageOptions \| dict[str, Any] \| None MQTT connection options.
    fs AbstractFileSystem \| None Filesystem instance for handling file operations.
    format str \| None File format extension (without dot). Default: "mqtt"
    basename str \| None Basename for the output file(s).
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: False
    mode str Write mode (append, overwrite, delete_matching, error_if_exists). Default: "append"
    unique bool \| list[str] \| str Unique columns for deduplication. Default: False
    mqtt_options dict[str, Any] Additional MQTT writer options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    write (data: pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any] \| list[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any]]], basename: str \| None = None, concat: bool \| None = None, unique: bool \| list[str] \| str \| None = None, mode: str \| None = None, **kwargs) -> dict[str, Any] Write data to file.
    metadata property Get metadata for the written data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.saver import MQTTSaver

# Initialize MQTT saver
saver = MQTTSaver(
    path="sensors/temperature",
    storage_options={
        "host": "mqtt.example.com",
        "port": 1883,
        "username": "user",
        "password": "password"
    }
)

# Write data
metadata = saver.write(df)

    Database Savers

    SQLiteSaver

    class SQLiteSaver(BaseDatabaseWriter, gc=False)

    Saver for SQLite databases.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    type_ str Database type. Default: "sqlite"
    table_name str Table name in the database. Default: ""
    path str \| None File path for SQLite database.
    connection_string str \| None Connection string for SQLAlchemy-based databases.
    username str \| None Username for the database.
    password str \| None Password for the database.
    server str \| None Server address for the database.
    port str \| int \| None Port number for the database.
    database str \| None Database name.
    ssl bool Enable SSL. Default: False
    _metadata dict[str, Any] Internal metadata storage.
    _data pa.Table \| pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pd.DataFrame \| dict \| list[dict] \| None Internal data storage.
    _ddb_con duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None Internal DuckDB connection.
    _dtf_ctx datafusion.SessionContext \| None Internal DataFusion context.
    mode str Write mode (append, replace, fail). Default: "append"
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: False
    unique bool \| list[str] \| str Unique columns for deduplication. Default: False
    sqlite_options dict[str, Any] Additional SQLite writer options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    write (data: pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any] \| list[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any]]], mode: str \| None = None, concat: bool \| None = None, unique: bool \| list[str] \| str \| None = None) -> dict[str, Any] Write data to database.
    metadata property Get metadata for the written data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.saver import SQLiteSaver

# Initialize SQLite saver
saver = SQLiteSaver(
    type_="sqlite",
    table_name="users",
    path="database.db",
    mode="append"
)

# Write data
metadata = saver.write(df)

    DuckDBSaver

    class DuckDBSaver(BaseDatabaseWriter, gc=False)

    Saver for DuckDB databases.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    type_ str Database type. Default: "duckdb"
    table_name str Table name in the database. Default: ""
    path str \| None File path for DuckDB database.
    connection_string str \| None Connection string for SQLAlchemy-based databases.
    username str \| None Username for the database.
    password str \| None Password for the database.
    server str \| None Server address for the database.
    port str \| int \| None Port number for the database.
    database str \| None Database name.
    ssl bool Enable SSL. Default: False
    _metadata dict[str, Any] Internal metadata storage.
    _data pa.Table \| pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pd.DataFrame \| dict \| list[dict] \| None Internal data storage.
    _ddb_con duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None Internal DuckDB connection.
    _dtf_ctx datafusion.SessionContext \| None Internal DataFusion context.
    mode str Write mode (append, replace, fail). Default: "append"
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: False
    unique bool \| list[str] \| str Unique columns for deduplication. Default: False
    duckdb_options dict[str, Any] Additional DuckDB writer options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    write (data: pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any] \| list[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any]]], mode: str \| None = None, concat: bool \| None = None, unique: bool \| list[str] \| str \| None = None) -> dict[str, Any] Write data to database.
    metadata property Get metadata for the written data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.saver import DuckDBSaver

# Initialize DuckDB saver
saver = DuckDBSaver(
    type_="duckdb",
    table_name="users",
    path="database.db",
    mode="append"
)

# Write data
metadata = saver.write(df)

    PostgreSQLSaver

    class PostgreSQLSaver(BaseDatabaseWriter, gc=False)

    Saver for PostgreSQL databases.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    type_ str Database type. Default: "postgres"
    table_name str Table name in the database. Default: ""
    path str \| None File path for SQLite or DuckDB databases.
    connection_string str \| None Connection string for SQLAlchemy-based databases.
    username str \| None Username for the database.
    password str \| None Password for the database.
    server str \| None Server address for the database.
    port str \| int \| None Port number for the database.
    database str \| None Database name.
    ssl bool Enable SSL. Default: False
    _metadata dict[str, Any] Internal metadata storage.
    _data pa.Table \| pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pd.DataFrame \| dict \| list[dict] \| None Internal data storage.
    _ddb_con duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None Internal DuckDB connection.
    _dtf_ctx datafusion.SessionContext \| None Internal DataFusion context.
    mode str Write mode (append, replace, fail). Default: "append"
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: False
    unique bool \| list[str] \| str Unique columns for deduplication. Default: False
    postgres_options dict[str, Any] Additional PostgreSQL writer options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    write (data: pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any] \| list[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any]]], mode: str \| None = None, concat: bool \| None = None, unique: bool \| list[str] \| str \| None = None) -> dict[str, Any] Write data to database.
    metadata property Get metadata for the written data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.saver import PostgreSQLSaver

# Initialize PostgreSQL saver
saver = PostgreSQLSaver(
    type_="postgres",
    table_name="users",
    host="localhost",
    username="user",
    password="password",
    database="mydb",
    mode="append"
)

# Write data
metadata = saver.write(df)

    MySQLSaver

    class MySQLSaver(BaseDatabaseWriter, gc=False)

    Saver for MySQL databases.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    type_ str Database type. Default: "mysql"
    table_name str Table name in the database. Default: ""
    path str \| None File path for SQLite or DuckDB databases.
    connection_string str \| None Connection string for SQLAlchemy-based databases.
    username str \| None Username for the database.
    password str \| None Password for the database.
    server str \| None Server address for the database.
    port str \| int \| None Port number for the database.
    database str \| None Database name.
    ssl bool Enable SSL. Default: False
    _metadata dict[str, Any] Internal metadata storage.
    _data pa.Table \| pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pd.DataFrame \| dict \| list[dict] \| None Internal data storage.
    _ddb_con duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None Internal DuckDB connection.
    _dtf_ctx datafusion.SessionContext \| None Internal DataFusion context.
    mode str Write mode (append, replace, fail). Default: "append"
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: False
    unique bool \| list[str] \| str Unique columns for deduplication. Default: False
    mysql_options dict[str, Any] Additional MySQL writer options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    write (data: pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any] \| list[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any]]], mode: str \| None = None, concat: bool \| None = None, unique: bool \| list[str] \| str \| None = None) -> dict[str, Any] Write data to database.
    metadata property Get metadata for the written data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.saver import MySQLSaver

# Initialize MySQL saver
saver = MySQLSaver(
    type_="mysql",
    table_name="users",
    host="localhost",
    username="user",
    password="password",
    database="mydb",
    mode="append"
)

# Write data
metadata = saver.write(df)

    MSSQLSaver

    class MSSQLSaver(BaseDatabaseWriter, gc=False)

    Saver for Microsoft SQL Server databases.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    type_ str Database type. Default: "mssql"
    table_name str Table name in the database. Default: ""
    path str \| None File path for SQLite or DuckDB databases.
    connection_string str \| None Connection string for SQLAlchemy-based databases.
    username str \| None Username for the database.
    password str \| None Password for the database.
    server str \| None Server address for the database.
    port str \| int \| None Port number for the database.
    database str \| None Database name.
    ssl bool Enable SSL. Default: False
    _metadata dict[str, Any] Internal metadata storage.
    _data pa.Table \| pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pd.DataFrame \| dict \| list[dict] \| None Internal data storage.
    _ddb_con duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None Internal DuckDB connection.
    _dtf_ctx datafusion.SessionContext \| None Internal DataFusion context.
    mode str Write mode (append, replace, fail). Default: "append"
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: False
    unique bool \| list[str] \| str Unique columns for deduplication. Default: False
    mssql_options dict[str, Any] Additional MSSQL writer options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    write (data: pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any] \| list[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any]]], mode: str \| None = None, concat: bool \| None = None, unique: bool \| list[str] \| str \| None = None) -> dict[str, Any] Write data to database.
    metadata property Get metadata for the written data.

    Example

    from flowerpower_io.saver import MSSQLSaver

# Initialize MSSQL saver
saver = MSSQLSaver(
    type_="mssql",
    table_name="users",
    host="localhost",
    username="user",
    password="password",
    database="mydb",
    mode="append"
)

# Write data
metadata = saver.write(df)

    OracleSaver

    class OracleSaver(BaseDatabaseWriter, gc=False)

    Saver for Oracle databases.

    Parameters

    Parameter Type Description
    type_ str Database type. Default: "oracle"
    table_name str Table name in the database. Default: ""
    path str \| None File path for SQLite or DuckDB databases.
    connection_string str \| None Connection string for SQLAlchemy-based databases.
    username str \| None Username for the database.
    password str \| None Password for the database.
    server str \| None Server address for the database.
    port str \| int \| None Port number for the database.
    database str \| None Database name.
    ssl bool Enable SSL. Default: False
    _metadata dict[str, Any] Internal metadata storage.
    _data pa.Table \| pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pd.DataFrame \| dict \| list[dict] \| None Internal data storage.
    _ddb_con duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection \| None Internal DuckDB connection.
    _dtf_ctx datafusion.SessionContext \| None Internal DataFusion context.
    mode str Write mode (append, replace, fail). Default: "append"
    concat bool Concatenate multiple files into a single DataFrame. Default: False
    unique bool \| list[str] \| str Unique columns for deduplication. Default: False
    oracle_options dict[str, Any] Additional Oracle writer options.

    Methods

    Method Signature Description
    write (data: pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any] \| list[pl.DataFrame \| pl.LazyFrame \| pa.Table \| pa.RecordBatch \| pa.RecordBatchReader \| pd.DataFrame \| dict[str, Any]]], mode: str \| None = None, concat: bool \| None = None, unique: bool \| list[str] \| str \| None = None) -> dict[str, Any] Write data to database.
    metadata property Get metadata for the written data.

    Example

    ```python from flowerpower_io.saver import OracleSaver

    Initialize Oracle saver

    saver = OracleSaver( type_="oracle", table_name="users", host="localhost", username="user", password="password", database="mydb", mode="append" )

    Write data

    metadata = saver.write(df)
